**Werebane** is an [artifact weapon](/wiki/Artifact_weapon "Artifact weapon") that appears in *[NetHack](/wiki/NetHack "NetHack")*. It is unaligned, and its [base item](/wiki/Base_item "Base item") is a [silver saber](/wiki/Silver_saber "Silver saber").

[ ]

## Contents

- [1 Generation](#Generation)

- [2 Description](#Description)

- [3 Strategy](#Strategy)

- [4 History](#History)

- [5 Variants](#Variants)

  - [5.1 SLASH'EM](#SLASH.27EM)

  - [5.6 EvilHack](#EvilHack)

## Generation

A randomly generated silver saber has a 1⁄20 chance of being generated as an artifact, which has a 1⁄2 chance of being Werebane (and will otherwise be [Grayswandir](/wiki/Grayswandir "Grayswandir"), the other artifact silver saber) if no artifacts have already been generated. Any character can receive Werebane as a [sacrifice gift](/wiki/Sacrifice_gift "Sacrifice gift"), but it will never be the first gift given.

## Description

Werebane has +1d5 [to-hit](/wiki/To-hit "To-hit") and deals [double damage](/wiki/Double_damage "Double damage") to [werecreatures](/wiki/Werecreature "Werecreature"), which is applied before the extra d20 of [silver](/wiki/Silver "Silver") damage. While wielded, Werebane prevents a [player](/wiki/Player "Player") character from being infected with [lycanthropy](/wiki/Lycanthropy "Lycanthropy").

## Strategy

Among the [Banes](/wiki/Banes "Banes"), Werebane is one of the more powerful artifacts against its target monsters, but against other monsters it is a slightly better silver saber, and thus unremarkable: the artifact can be a fine option in the early game for characters that would ordinarily have trouble with werewolves, but players able to compensate for such a power gap will have less use for the weapon. The trait that holds Werebane back the most is the fact that its bonus only applies to three monsters, all of which are primarily found in a particular stage of the game - once a character advances past that stage, they will be contending with non-werecreature monsters more often, and usually can attain the resources to make werecreatures themselves a non-issue.

One perk to receiving Werebane as a sacrifice gift is that it unrestricts the [saber](/wiki/Saber "Saber") skill for characters that have either already found [Grayswandir](/wiki/Grayswandir "Grayswandir") randomly or via [bones](/wiki/Bones "Bones"), or else plan to [wish](/wiki/Wish "Wish") for it later. A silver saber with a to-hit bonus is also a servicable weapon, though it cannot be two-weaponed in the offhand.

## History

Werebane first appears in [NetHack 3.0.0](/wiki/NetHack_3.0.0 "NetHack 3.0.0"), where it is a [lawful](/wiki/Lawful "Lawful") artifact [long sword](/wiki/Long_sword "Long sword"). [NetHack 3.1.0](/wiki/NetHack_3.1.0 "NetHack 3.1.0") changes the base item to a silver saber, and [NetHack 3.3.0](/wiki/NetHack_3.3.0 "NetHack 3.3.0") changes its alignment to unaligned.

## Variants

### SLASH'EM

In [SLASH'EM](/wiki/SLASH%27EM "SLASH'EM"), Werebane has a 1⁄6 chance of [canceling](/wiki/Canceling "Canceling") werecreatures that it strikes.[\[1\]](#cite_note-1)

Changes to other artifact mechanics, [polymorph](/wiki/Polymorph "Polymorph") mechanics and the addition of several stronger werecreatures make Werebane a more viable weapon: polymorphed monsters (including werecreatures) revert to their base form upon death - combined with the werecreature's [regeneration](/wiki/Regeneration "Regeneration") and summoning, they can be quite difficult to kill permanently, making Werebane much more valuable against them. Werebane can also be twoweaponed in the offhand with another artifact weapon, making it an attractive secondary option.

### UnNetHack

In [UnNetHack](/wiki/UnNetHack "UnNetHack"), Werebane grants [warning versus werecreatures](/wiki/Warned_of_monster_type "Warned of monster type").

### dNetHack

In [dNetHack](/wiki/DNetHack "DNetHack"), Werebane has +1d10 to hit and deals +1d20 damage against werecreatures and [demihumans](/wiki/Demihuman "Demihuman"), and has a 1⁄10 chance of cancelling such monsters it hits, subject to [monster magic resistance scores](/wiki/Magic_resistance_\(monster\) "Magic resistance (monster)"). Werebane also protects from lycanthropy while wielded, and does not resist being held second to other weapons - however, doing so incurs a -20 to-hit penalty unless the character is Expert in two-weapon fighting.

### FIQHack

In [FIQHack](/wiki/FIQHack "FIQHack"), Werebane deals +1d20 damage against werecreatures instead of double damage.

### SpliceHack

In [SpliceHack](/wiki/SpliceHack "SpliceHack"), Werebane can be twoweaponed with another artifact weapon.

### EvilHack

In [EvilHack](/wiki/EvilHack "EvilHack"), Werebane can be combined with [Stormbringer](/wiki/Stormbringer "Stormbringer") at a [forge](/wiki/Forge_\(dungeon_feature\) "Forge (dungeon feature)") to create [Shadowblade](/wiki/Shadowblade "Shadowblade").

## References
